sentence.Network_en: Prince Edward threw the switch to light the illuminations.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱德华王子按动开关亮起彩灯。

sentence.Network_en: We are going to town to see the illuminations.
They will celebrate it with thanksgiving , with festivity , with bonfires, and illuminations.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将感激满怀,载歌载舞,高燃篝火, 张灯结彩庆此佳节.

entry.def: Illumination is the lighting that a place has.

example.ex: The only illumination came from a small window high in the opposite wall.
example.tran: 唯一的亮光来自对面墙上高处的一扇小窗子。

entry.def: Illuminations are coloured lights which are put up in towns, especially at Christmas, in order to make them look attractive, especially at night.

example.tran: 著名的布莱克浦彩灯节

entry.def: You can use illumination to describe an increased understanding of something, especially something of a religious or spiritual nature.

example.ex: No further illumination can be had from this theory.
example.tran: 这一理论不能给人以更深刻的启迪。
